title: Apparently "Gaming" Chromebooks Exist
description: I bought a crazy expensive "Cloud Gaming" chromebook.  The full video on the actual gaming laptop in this video:   Get some AWESOME Dawid T-shirts, Mouse pads and more here:   Play some Minecraft on the Dawid Does Minecraft server courtesy of our friends at Linode! Dawid Does Minecraft Name: Mctenthiddy, server IP: mc.tenthiddy.com It works on Java version 1.19.3  Support the channel on Patreon:    *Follow me on whichever Social media you don't hate* Discord:  Twitch:  Twitch bits on YouTube:
transcript: now as you can tell from the box, this is a Chromebook. But according to Asus, it's more than that. According to Asus this is a 'Cloud Gaming Laptop'. And because Asus went to all the trouble of using the word 'Gaming' several times in the marketing, I had to pay 700 US Dollars before tax for this Chromebook so that we can see what kind of gaming experience it really offers whoa that's not a great start is it after a quick bit of research it turns out Aces isn't the only company doing this gaming Chromebooks are fairly common and it's pretty difficult for me to talk about the pricing of these things without getting wildly inappropriate the top of the line version of this Asus gaming Chromebook normally costs a butthole puckering 1300 Canadian rubles you can buy one hell of an actual gaming laptop with that yeah I don't know I feel like buying a fancy Chromebook is like buying a luxury tricycle a tricycle isn't the end goal it's just a thing toddlers use to get used to the idea of an actual bicycle just buy a real laptop I don't understand but I'm always open to new things so let's check out this cloud gaming laptop now in all fairness to Asus for a Chromebook this is reasonably beefy we don't even have a mediatek cell phone chip in here or emmc storage compared to a real laptop however it starts to get a lot less impressive but we'll talk about that a bit later thank you standard Asus laptop packaging we've got raw cardboard I guess is the pretentious way of referring to that and in this nice fabric bag that's protecting the very expensive Chromebook in here yeah it's pretty nice first off we get these little bookies one of which is a gaming offer I think this laptop comes with three months of the RTX 3080 hardware that's actually running the games you get a nice tiny power brick can you get it off with one tug let's see I guess not it is very Hefty for a Chromebook this is a reasonably well-built to see if for 700 we get a Chromebook that passes the one hand open test this is very important oh it doesn't so it's just trash and after having to open the Chromebook using both my hands like some and a bit too squishy but it's serviceable and for you recreational Excel users we've got a numpad on the side I feel like it's a little redundant on a Chromebook but it's nice to have I want to turn it may very well have been a bit too glossy for its own good but we'll talk more about that when we try and game on it first let's open this Chromebook and have a closer look at its guts the only I got the bottom off there we go oh but don't forget the aces special a hidden little ribbon cable for you to accidentally destroy when taking the bottom off so that rear is about 78 more annoying to get off than it possibly has the right to be it's actually made by foxconnor oh okay so this is basically a Macbook that's pretty cool which I guess explains the solder down 8 gigs of RAM always nice to see but we actually have an upgradable SSD in here let's have a look there it is all 128 gigs of it which we can easily access just by destroying the laptop cooling wise this looks pretty good for OS something like asphalt 17 losers is pretty representative of the kind of games you can play physically on it I'm assuming this is gonna run very well because it is a phone game and we have actual laptop Hardware in here but it really didn't how is it so stuttery what in the world I don't think I mined this game running badly it's just it's really stupid it feels like watching a cinematic that every now and then prompts you to press a button so you feel like you're contributing at this point I'm sure a bunch of you are thinking but all of it this thing would likely be great for emulating old games yeah but you know what else is great for emulating old games a real laptop besides these days the hardware that powers my catheter tube can emulate the crap out of old games you don't need to spend 700 on a Chromebook for that uh but but anyway let's try and use it for its intended use case cloud gaming as I mentioned before the little Chromebook comes with three months of the RTX 3080 years for example gaming at the GeForce now tier they bait you in with that's 480 US Dollars which doesn't even include the cost of the games these laptops like the cloud gaming service equivalent of a heroin dealer at least there is a free tier if you're okay with one hour gaming sessions and worse performance but on the note of performance let's see how this runs cloud gaming oh that is not a very good start something's just adjusted and now it's running better but no it isn't it's still shockingly bad as far as I understand I'm in a prime GeForce Now location and my internet handles it well I've used it before not with this kind of performance so I'm not sure what's happening now it could be a network issue but that's the problem with this kind of thing if the Network's in a bit of a mood this happens and I'm gonna try wired internet uh we don't have an ethernet port but I have an adapter we can use via USBC let's plug it in and see if that helps a few moments later oh wow that is so much better it still looks a bit compression artifacty but it feels infinitely better it's not stuttering and this reasonable input lag so with that let's try another game now fortnite is running pretty well you can see in the very tiny letters up there that we are getting well over 120 frames per second and this is with 1080p competitive settings now one of the reasons I always use fortnite is because it's the game I found that runs the best on GeForce now the input latency and stuff is very low it just feels good and it's always impressive how well this runs on cloud gaming but you know what also runs it well an actual gaming laptop wow cyberpunk feels pretty sticky it looks pretty good and I think the frame rate's reasonable but you can clearly feel the input lag here and that's one of the problems with GeForce now not only does it not have a particularly big library of games but there's a big variation in how the games that it does support runs for every Fortnight level experience there's a game that runs like this now considering that this Chromebook has Intel Hardware on it I think it should be pretty easy to install Windows on it to see how it runs games by its own self but before we do that let's quickly compare this cloud gaming experience to the gaming experience of a real gaming laptop at roughly the same price the real boy gaming laptop was from a recent video and it's also by Aces as you can see by the specs it is a reasonable bit beefier than the Chromebook and I only paid the equivalent of about 500 US dollars for it it was on sale but it is quite a bit cheaper than the Chromebook and has an actual graphics card in it so let's see how the gaming experience Compares now with fortnite running at the same settings we are not getting as high a frame rate but it actually feels better because the system is running it here so there isn't that input latency feel of cloud gaming fortnite may work well with GeForce now but even with this kind of laptop you can still feel the difference and the thing is this is with the laptop running in a single Channel Ram configuration which really kicks its performance in the balls if you upgrade the RAM to a proper configuration it makes a huge difference check out the dedicated video on this laptop for more information now I will say that the Chromebook was much quieter while gaming because you know it doesn't have Hardware running the game in it and the display isn't quite as nice although it's a decent display it's still 144 Hertz and it is an IPS panel so it's not as good but it's still a pretty good display so if anything I would say that this is running the game better than the Chromebook was just because of that lack of latency now when it comes to cyberpunk at 1080p low settings it's a bit of a mixed bag in terms of visuals it doesn't look as good as the cloud gaming experience and the frame rate is lower but it doesn't have that input lag so I don't really know who to give it to here the laptop may not have the input latency but its visuals and frame rate is much worse but at least you don't have to pay twenty dollars a month for it to run like this anyway with that pretty unscientific comparison out the way the last thing I want to do is install Windows on the little Chromebook so it can run games with its own steam horsepower power oh okay oh the ribbon cable foreign so after quite a lot of struggle we're finally at the point where we've got windows installed on here and we can run some games physically on this very expensive Chromebook now I did run into a couple of problems the first one is that the only i o on the laptop that works is the one square USB port so back here it's a bit of a dongle nightmare the trackpad also doesn't work and the audio doesn't work none of the Jacks nor does the speakers so at this point it's like a third of a laptop but at least we can see how it runs games right sure it's gonna be very impressive so at the end of the day all I had to do to run some Steam games natively on the device was physically break it and then spend two hours hacking Windows onto it just to have half of the laptop not working anymore and all that for 40 frames per second at normal settings up a hill yeah I don't know I guess it's convinced me I don't think it's stupid anymore thank you foreign
